abstract: American officials say White House convened meeting to tackle issue of what to do if Libyan dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddafi was captured alive before his death; meeting attests to deep sensitivity of issue and ambivalence it stirred on part of Libya's interim leaders and senior administration officials.
snippet: A White House meeting was convened last week to tackle the issue of what to do if the Libyan leader were captured alive.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: A White House meeting was convened last week to tackle the issue of what to do if the Libyan leader were captured alive.

headline.main: Before Qaddafi’s Death, U.S. Debated His Future
headline.print_headline: Before Qaddafi’s Death, U.S. Debated His Future
